page.title: 16Biography
page.content: {Gwenallt}(David James Jones - 1889-1968) chose this Bardic name from the mountain "Y Wenallt". His contribution to Welsh poetry is immense. In 1926 he won the Bardic Chair in the National Eisteddfod at Swansea with a poem called "Y Mynach" written in strict Welsh metre. His poems "Eples", "Credaf" & "Ysgubau'r Awen" have greatly influenced Welsh poets. He wrote two novels, "Plasau'r Brenin" and "Gwreichion". {Rachel Howel Thomas,}born in Alltwen was educated locally. Initially a teacher she later obtained a contract with the B.B.C., having parts in various English and Welsh programmes and became a famous personality. In 1939 she starred with singer Paul Robeson in the film 'Proud Valley' and later acted in famous screen & stage works obtaining the O.B.E. in 1968.
